org.jcvlib.io

Class VideoFileWriter

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jcvlib.io.VideoFileWriter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    VideoWriter

    public class VideoFileWriter
extends java.lang.Object
implements VideoWriter
    This class allow write video to disk.

    Video is a stream of images. Because of that we should have a object that will be save state to correct writing.

    Example of usage: 

     ...
 // String filePath = ...
 // Size sizeOfVideo = ...
 // int FPS = ...
 VideoFileWriter video = new VideoFileWriter(filePath, sizeOfVideo, FPS);
 video.open();
 ...
 // Image image = ...
 ...
 video.addImage(image);
 ...
 video.close();
 ...

    Author:
    Dmitry Zavodnikov (d.zavodnikov@gmail.com)

    • Constructor Detail

      • VideoFileWriter

        public VideoFileWriter(java.lang.String filePath,
                       Size sizeOfVideo,
                       int FPS,
                       int numPicturesInGroupOfPictures,
                       int bitRate)
                throws java.io.IOException
        Create new object for write video into the file.
        Parameters:
        filePath - Path to file for output.
        sizeOfVideo - Size of video for saving.
        FPS - Frame rate per second in Hz.
        numPicturesInGroupOfPictures - Determines the number of interframes between each keyframe.
        bitRate - Bit rate of video in Kbit per second (kbps). You can use 32 kbps, 64 kbps, 128 kbps, 256 kbps and so on. The relationship between the bit rate and the size of your video is also not quite linear. I've found that setting the bit rate too low actually increases the size of the video. Why this is I don't know, but just as a precaution you might want to play with the bit rate a little bit.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • VideoFileWriter

        public VideoFileWriter(java.lang.String filePath,
                       Size sizeOfImageIntoVideo)
                throws java.io.IOException
        Create new object for write video into the file. Using 30 FPS, 10 pictures in group of pictures and 128 kbps as default value.
        Parameters:
        filePath - Path to file for output.
        sizeOfImageIntoVideo - Size of image (width and height) into video.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
